Reviews.Title: “St. Patty's Day, St. Crowne Plaza :)”
Reviews.Author: Alexa L
Reviews.Content: I was here over Patty's day weekend... This hotel was wonderful, very accommodating staff, especially Curtis and the Sales woman Nicole, to the men/valet in the parking lot and luggage room. Nicely decorated, balcony in every room a huge plus especially when it's a beautiful weekend; comfy beds, nice bathroom and lovely desk! nice location! just off the Dan Ryan and still extraordinarily quiet along with the river so near and walkable train stops! I will be back for my next reunion! Thanks Crowne staff -Alexa Lauren

Reviews.Title: “The prperty still looks fresh, and the surrounding area has really improved!”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo_Bruce
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property several years ago after it received a much needed remodel. The property looks very fresh, in fact it could have received another updated since my last visit. This is the new euro style Crowne Plaza motif. I was upgraded to the executive floor and the corner suite was beyond my expectations. The view of Chicago skyline was wonderful. All the amenities you would expect at a newer Crowne Plaza, robes in the closet, modern clean furniture and large flat screen TV’s. The bed was a bit harder than most Crowne Plaza’s, usually they have those wonderful pillow top beds, not here unfortunately. But the Linens were first class, and the towels soft. The shower even though it was a bath/shower combo, was very nice with ample pressure and hot water. The service was very good, but I get the feeling that it is slightly less if you have an issue, might just be Chicago, or the management. But if there are no issues, it’s very pleasant service. My observation is from listening to others at the front desk. The property is adjacent to the Dan Ryan freeway. When on the balcony it is very noisy on a Friday night. But the sliding window is very effective and one might not know they were near a freeway. This leads me to believe that much of the noise in most hotels come through the wall air conditioner, which this property does not have. It has a much better central built in fan system. Parking is very expensive for being this far from the loop. As of Mar 2012 it is $36 per day for valet parking. There is no self park. A good tip for the cost conscious is to park just to the north of the Walgreens adjacent to the property. Its only $6 per day on Saturday and Sunday. Less than a 100 yard walk. The surrounding area is much improved. It is called Greek Town and has many Greek restaurants. Many offer open windows, one even has a retractable roof. Within 4 city blocks there is traditional Chicago pizza. I observed several woman walking alone at night in the area indicating that it is much safer then it was just a few years ago. The area is now home to several new upscale apartments and is flanked on the north and south side by a Walgreens and Dominick’s stores. It is close enough to the loop to walk safely (1/2 mile), or a easy taxi ride. But if you get in late on a Friday or are there on business there is ample food choices nearby without a car. Its my new choice when the Miracle Mile properties are sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and good price”
Reviews.Author: Kieran L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza Metro. We were in town for a fencing tournament and wanted to stay close enough to downtown to visit some of the major attractions. This hotel is within easy access to the loop (walking distance if the weather is nice) and right on the CTA bus lines if you don't want to drive yourself. Parking was a little tricky, but the valet staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms look recently updated, and the decor in the hotel was very nice. Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming.The views from the balcony of the skyline are simply breath-taking (for a tourist). We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet night of sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa197676
Reviews.Content: My doctor booked my sleep study at this location, thinking it would be better than the sterile environment of a sleep clinic. Well, I've had to deal with drilling in the walls starting at 11:30pm. It's now 1:38am, and this has been going on every 30 minutes for 10-15 minutes at a time. I have taken video evidence, as this is ridiculous. When I called down to the front desk, I was told that the owner's brother was doing the construction and that it would not stop. I reminded them that their core business is having people pay to sleep in their facility, and that drilling in the walls late at night goes against it. He said there was nothing he could do. Never again will I stay in this pit, where they don't value business.

Reviews.Title: “My preferred business hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Todd C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels across the city and I prefer this one because it's a little outside of the action, yet very short walk to great restaurants/pubs and right next to grocery store and pharmacy. Walkable to Union Station and Willis Tower, but cab to lakeside or Michigan Ave. People who make negative comments probably rarely travel and have no comparison. I only wish they would upgrade there fitness center....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: danielle F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at The Crowne Plaza Metro after a 20 hour train ride at 11:00AM, obviously the first thing we wanted to do was take a shower, but since check in is at 3PM we didn't think we had a chance. Luckily our room was ready and we were able to check in. James brought our bags to our room and even got us an upgrade on our room because of the length of our stay {Let's just say we are Priority Platinum member now for the next couple of years}. I recommend applying for Prority rewards- If you are a member you get a free drink voucher, so why not! Plus you quickly add points which earns you free nights stay at any Intercontinental, Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn. comfortable. We had two balconies which faced the Wills Tower. Our room was very large. It had a sitting area with flat screen TV, pull out bed couch and desk and a separate bedroom area with another flat screen TV. There is a coffee machine, Iron, hair dryer and a safe in the room. The bedding is very plush, soft andower. Amazing how you open the balcony door and the raucous buzz of the city invades, but close it and it's quite peaceful. There is also free Internet in your room. The staff here is great. They are very friendly, nice and always want to help your stay in Chicago be it's best. On Wednesdays they host a Wine and Cheese party hosted by two of the staff members. This allows the staff to really get to mingle with the guests and answer any questions they may have. The location is excellent. The blue line train is a couple of blocks away and only cost $2.50 to get to the airport, if you decide to take a cab that is about $40. The hotel is in Greek Town, so there's plenty to do there and plenty of restaurants to eat at. If you do not feel like leaving the hotel Dine is a great place to go. You can either sit in the dining room, that has a fancy menu or sit at the bar which has a bar menu. If you like IPAs my husband loved the local beer Daisy Cutter which they have on tap. If you are planing to see a taping of the Rosie show or attend a game at the United Center- this hotel is perfect for you. There is no pool, but the exercise room was clean and nice. I would stay here again with no hesitation and I will definitely recommend it to my friends and family. The price of the rooms are an excellent value for all of the amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: merri s
Reviews.Content: The bed was so firm and uncomfortable that I was not able to sleep!! Also they over charged my credit card by 60 dollars. I had to spend 20 minutes getting my money back to my credit card. The service people were unhelpful and rude. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone; well maybe if you donâ€™t want any sleep and you want to be over charged than go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Was a nice hotel with a great parking package, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Blake F
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel and the parking package made it a steal (Only ten dollars more for a 35 dollar valet parking). Though I would caution if you are looking to get a good nights sleep before a big interview. I had a professional school interview the next morning, and I barely got any sleep with how noisy it was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: 7bharats
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Metro in Chicago is right on the West Loop and provides amazing views of downtown Chicago, especially the Willis Tower. Everything is just a couple of minutes of walk away; a bus stand, lots of restaurants, other shops/stores. A CTA station is about 5mins away. We got a good deal through priceline and were really happy with the hotel. The only hitch was that there is no self-park in the hotel and the valet parking is too expensive. Atleast the valet directed us to a public pay-parking lot just a block away, which was much cheaper. Did not try out the in-hotel dining, so no comments. The rooms were spacious, neat and well-maintained. Would definitely recommend if you get a good deal on the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service around issues”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: I helped my son book an overnight stay at Crowne Plaza hotel. We booked through orbitz.com which I will warn you, does not always give accurate information regarding "rules" around a hotel stay, even when speaking with a person live. Our challenge was to find a nice hotel near United Center as my son who is 20 and his girlfriend had tickets for the Bulls and Hawks games back to back. My son is on a budget and so it was important that there was no high fees for parking. Also since he is 20 we wanted to make sure there were no issues with him checking in. Again, booked through Orbitz who confirmed there were no restrictions on age and also that parking was free. My son arrives at the hotel, calls me very freaked out to find out that first, he has to be 21 to get the room and second, there is only valet parking at a cost of $30 per 24 hours. He handed the phone to the manager, Michael, whom I spoke to and explained the due diligence I did in booking the room, the information received from Orbitz and also that the write up on Orbitz.com listed parking and valet parking indicating there were two options for parking. This situation could have turned out to be a nightmare but Michael exhibited excellent customer service in handling the situation. He asked that I send him an email confirming I would take responsibility for my son and second asked I email the description listed on Orbitz and our reservation regarding no mention of fees with parking. I did both and he not only let my son and his girlfriend get the room, he waived the parking fee for the night. He handled the situation well! My son said the room was great, they ordered room service and learned the hard way how much that cost and had a great night watching the Bulls down the street! Thank you Michael and Crowne Plaza Chicago for making my son's weekend trip wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Wonderful Staff. Love The Location & Price.”
Reviews.Author: Samatha S
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel and was greeted by a Rock Star, Curtis (front desk staff). He was very Charming, Handsome, KNOWLEDGEABLE, and Well Groomed. I travel so much for work and stay at so many hotels, never before was I greeted and treated with V.I.P treatement. My trip to Chicago was a weekend getaway with my husband. We was at the front desk everyday of our stay because of Curtis. Restaurant recommendations was to die for (RL Bar & Grill, Girl & The Goat, Sunda, & Japonais). We were able to get into all restaurants during prime time dinner hours, which I notice was hard to do on weekends in Chicago. Each restaurant treated us as if we was with Curtis & gave awesome service (free desert at Sunda :). Curtis gave so much information about the city & different shopping areas - Lincoln Park, Wicker Park, Downtown. Checking into the Crowne Plaza Chicago was the best experience. The Hotel is close to everything. Internet is free, Work out room was nice and clean, Coffee and newspaper free everyday. I can't believe all of this for such a great price. I will visit Chicago more and only stay at Crowne Plaza Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for the noise from the highway”
Reviews.Author: tesseract68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for a business trip, and transportation and the biil was taken care of, so price and location were not so much of an issue. This hotel is in Greek town and many very nice restaurants (not all of them are Greek) are very close by. However, it's not very close to the main tourist attractions in downtown Chicago. The rooms are really nicely appointed--the furniture and decor are very up to date and very tasteful. Also, the rooms have really great desks built into the wall that have plenty of room for spreading out while you are working--I think this was probably the best hotel room desk I've encountered so far. In addition, there is not just free WiFi (which gets really slow in the evening due to all the usage) but also ethernet access (and a cable) which was incredibly useful when WiFi got to be slow. The room was very clean, where even the bedspread did not seem questionable, and the room smelled like fresh laundry. The bed was very comfortable as well. The bathroom was also very clean and nicely arranged (lots of counter space) but one thing was that the hardware on the adjustable showerhead was either stuck or not operational at some of the joints. so the showerhead had to be pointed in this weird way for you to use it. Otherwise the bathroom was just fine. One thing about this hotel is that it is very noisy from the highway, especially if you are not used to the traffic. My room was very high up and thus had a great view, but also experienced a lot of highway noise. The noise really is significant, so on the second night I used the earplugs that the hotel supplied, as well as a pillow over my head, and that helped quite a bit. Other amenities include use of the exercise room which has decent equipment, and also a business center with computers and printers. Also, they give away coffee in the lobby in the morning. The service in the hotel was excellent, and although I didn't have any problems, they seemed to be very attentive, where even the night manager left a message on the voicemail to let you know who to contact if you needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: kayachik14
Reviews.Content: This place had a great location; easily walkable to the loop in downtown chicago.It is also just adjacent to Greek town with several eating options within a five minute walk. The room was a decent size and it was very clean and nicely decorated. The hallway was always silent and I can say there was zero street noise, which was minimal even with the sliding balcony door open. We stayed as part of a wedding party, and we also had the reception and a buffet breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. I was pleased with the both the reception offerings and the selection at the restaurant. My one complaint would be the parking. It is like $36 a night and the valet took forever to get our car. There is overnight parking for much less to the south and east of the hotel, so I would suggest parking there and walking to save money.

Reviews.Title: “19 rooms and no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: valstewart557
Reviews.Content: We recently used this hotel as the "preferred" hotel for guests traveling to Chicago for my daughter's wedding (held at a nearby venue). Our friends and family occupied 19 rooms. Length of stay varied from 1 to 4 nights. The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and most important to me, the hotel hallways were generally quiet. Amazing, since there were at least 3 other weddings in the hotel that weekend. The staff, from the front desk clerks to the parking attendants, were courteous, friendly, and helpful. Not one complaint from any of our guests! A good mid-priced hotel in a terrific city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: drejr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December of 2006 while looking for an apartment. The staff was great. The rooms were great. The location was excellent. Not too much for a cab to get to Midway. Knowing what I know now about the city, it's only a short bus trip and a train to get to Midway. The hotel is in Greek Town, so there's plenty to do there. Or, hop on the Halsted bus and head to the Wrigley area, or the Madison bus will take you directly into the heart of downtown. The restaurant was ok, nothing special. Had a room looking north, but could easily see into The Loop.

Reviews.Title: “More of a business hotel than a leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel without really knowing the area, and wasn't really thrilled about the neighborhood. It's a bit of a remote location if you're a tourist, especially if you're used to staying on the Loop or on Mag Mile; the hotel is the tallest building on that side of the Interstate, and it's only about 14 stories. Check-in was frustrating; we tried for an early check-in and were told the room would be ready in "about an hour" so we wandered to the adjacent grocery store and camped out in the Starbucks there, as a rowdy wedding party had taken over the hotel lobby; upon returning, we were told it would be another "half hour or so" and that pattern kept up for a full 4 hours or so... honestly if they'd said it would be 4 hours from the get-go, we'd have gone and done something, not hung around the lobby! Once in the room, the furnishings were quite nice, simple but stylish; fairly comfortable bed (the Mister liked it more than I did), and everything very clean. We had a balcony but didn't spend much time on it. Hotel gives free wi-fi which works quite well in the lobby and is painfully slow in the guest rooms. There is quite a bit of freeway noise but oddly it becomes soothing, like a white noise machine, after a bit. Some of the doormen (particularly the one who stored our bags) are a bit surly. Had breakfast at the adjacent hotel, Dine. Food was quite nice and prices were very good, especially by hotel standards. Service, on the other hand, was completely absent. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again simply because of the location; they do charge Mag Mile rates and it's not a neighborhood that should command those prices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Flynlo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for business trip for 3 days. Check in was fast, friendly. Lobby was clean and nicely decorated (good indicator of room quality). Rooms were very spacious and clean. As with most Chicago hotels downtown, it's an older building and sometimes in the hallways you kind of get that old hotel smell, but I think they are doing a very good job keeping this one up. Really nice was each room has a small balcony that you can step out on and take in the city. Not much to see from this direction, but enough. Amazing how you open the balcony door and the raucous buzz of the city invades, but close it and it's quite peaceful. Only kind of negative I had was I'm 6'4" and the beds, while comfortable, seemed more like a full than a queen. For convenience to down town at a value, it's not the Ritz, and may not be quite up to "Crowne" standards, but is a good basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MST5110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as it had a special rate for a wedding I attended. The hotel was nice, and had modern decor. The room was nice, and the bed comfartable although the pillows are small. I called and asked for more pillows, and they brought me a pillow and a blanket so not sure what that was about. The staff was polite and helpful. I did not care for the restaurant attached as the food was not very good for dinner, and the breakfast buffet overpriced for what you get. The hotel was in a decent location. Overall, It was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Queen67
Reviews.Content: I loved accommodations, the location, the attractions and the city itself! We happen to visity over the 4th of July which included the Taste of Chicago event. What a treat! The hotel is around the corner from Magnificent Mile, so you are definitely in the heart of downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Beds are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family wedding. It's walking distance to downtown chicago. we went to millennium park and michigan avenue. prices are great for what you get. the beds are amazing. i slept better than i ever have. service is great too :) breakfast in "dine" restaurant downstairs is nothing to write home about. I'd eat somewhere else if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and a great stay”
Reviews.Author: chris1999
Reviews.Content: There's nothing to complain about here. The hotel was excellent and the location great, too. walking distance to some great places to eat and a short taxi ride to all the other things we wanted to see. I would stay here again with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Little faulty details”
Reviews.Author: Pollescu
Reviews.Content: This was my first booking at the Crowne Plaza Metro. I choose the hotel mainly because of its location and price. Nothing was bad, but nothing was excellent. I found several little details that could easily be improved. For example: - Walls are paper thin. I had a joyful couple next door that just didnâ€™t let me sleep. - The bathroomâ€™s door is not tight enough. Itâ€™s a sliding door and you get the sensation that it cannot fully close. - In the bathroom, you can hear your neighbors through the air vents. - The closet has no doors, itâ€™s just a curtain (very similar to a shower curtain) The only bad experience I had was with one guy from the reception. I needed to mail some documents and I asked him if he could help me. He was rude, he just told me to go buy some stamps and find a mailbox on the street. If the hotel has a Business Center they should have some stamps on sale, or at least point me to the nearest mailbox. Anyway, the Hotel is clean yet these little details made my stay, an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slwhite
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, close to everything and staff was wonderful. They upgraded my room upon arrival without me asking because occupancy was low that evening. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Bell hop is the reason I will return...”
Reviews.Author: O O
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I reserved this hotel for a quick get a way. Well I was nervous as to what room I would get as I used one of those discounted hotel room websites. I called the room to see if a King bed was available. The lady over the phone stated she saw the request but that would be handled when I checked in. At check in the Guest Service Rep check us into a double bed room. I said no I requested a King bed. He says okay we have one. I then began to ask what rooms had what views and etc. He stated he didnt know. I was shocked. As I use to work in the hotel industry and we went through our property so we could anwser those questions for our guest. Anyhow, after the whole check in. I just didnt feel welcomed by this particular guy. However, the bell hop by the name of Aspin(sp) was SUPERB!!!! I read about him before in reviews. He is what customer service should be. He was able to direct us to some nice jazz clubs and restaurants. What a true Gem you guys have with him!! The next day at check out he was around. Once again a great help. Give that man a hand clap. He is the reason I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: While the staff is nice, the hotel is basic but clean, and the location is close to downtown, you need to avoid this hotel at all costs. The property is built literally on top of I94 - this is the major highway going right through Chicago. Trucks, cars, busses, ambulances, and everything else is blasting by your room all night. Even the free earplugs they give away (yes, they give earplugs) don't help. Don't stay here!!! As I write this at 4.45 am (couldn't sleep), I am vowing to never return.

Reviews.Title: “Failure from Every Angle - Avoid This Property”
Reviews.Author: plagwate
Reviews.Content: The following is correspondence sent to the Crowne Plaza Chicago Metro's corporate management (IHG) regarding a stay I experienced back in May. Despite sending the original complaint on June 4 with follow-up on July 26 and August 18, I still have not received what was promised to me. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I recently completed a three-night stay with a large group at the Crowne Plaza Chicago Metro. While I am not a top-tier Platinum PC member, I am a Gold PC member and was disappointed in multiple facets of my stay which I will outline below. â€¢ At check-in, I was assigned to a â€œKing Petiteâ€� room (though nothing in my booking indicated such). When I asked if a standard King room was available, I was told that the hotel was completely sold out. This was at 1:30 in the afternoon. A rack of approximately 40 portfolios that had not yet checked-in was clearly visible. Am I to believe that all of those portfolios were higher-level Platinum members, Double rooms and/or King Petites as well? Frankly, it seemed that the desk clerk was too lazy to be bothered. He did offer to exchange my room the next day if something came available. But why wasnâ€™t program status even considered when making the dayâ€™s room assignments to begin with? â€¢ The room I received was cramped. It honestly felt like a New York City hotel room. Granted the furnishings had been updated but this is a small consolation if the facility itself is uncomfortable. I needed to go out for a couple of hours and stopped by the front desk to reiterate my displeasure after seeing the room. I told the desk clerk that I was not unpacked and would be willing to relocate if there were cancellations. The desk clerk said he would let me know. I asked him if he remembered my name. He did not and then asked for my room number (a sure indication that he intended to do nothing in the first place since he hadnâ€™t recorded it earlier). I was never contacted again by the desk clerk or management. â€¢ Climate control in this room was lacking. Despite repeated attempts to adjust the temperature, the room maintained the constant feel and smell of a high school locker room. Notably there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom which likely contributes to this odor. â€¢ I should also mention that the â€œfree high speed internetâ€� is anything but high speed. The connection failed constantly, both wired and wirelessly. Fortunately, my smartphone and IPad were able to fill the void where the internet service failed. Of course this meant that I could not send work files from my laptop as needed. â€¢ The next morning I awoke to no hot water. I called downstairs to the front desk to inquire. An exasperated operator cut me off mid-sentence. Apparently, there was none for the entire hotel. At least I got to take a cold shower in a small, cramped bathroom. **sigh** The lack of hot water must have had an impact on the hotelâ€™s laundry as well. When my room was cleaned for the day, the used towels were removed. However, they were not replaced. Itâ€™s a good thing I had one set remaining. The standard provision of three towel sets wasnâ€™t restored until the following dayâ€™s cleaning. Oddly enough, a friend who was also staying in the hotel said he received extra towels that day. Perhaps "petite" isn't only a reference to the room, but the maintenance of its amenities as well. â€¢ On Saturday evening (approximately 9-9:30 p.m.), I ate dinner at the on-site restaurant. I was alone, was seated in the dining room and given the â€œbar menuâ€� (limited late evening offerings). I ordered a simple grilled ham & cheese sandwich with french fries. While waiting, I observed my surroundings. A male-female couple were seated and offered the bar menu as well as the full dinner menu. Another couple (male-male) were seated and offered the limited bar menu. A single male diner was seated and was also given the bar menu. Finally, a group of four (two men, two women) were seated and given the full dinner menu. Must a lady be seated at your table in order to eat from the full dinner menu? I should also note that all four of these tables received their meals before I did. Thirty minutes later, my sandwich and fries arrived; hot but still last in line despite being first to order. â€¢ At check-out, I was greeted by the front desk clerk and asked if â€œeverything on my bill was o.k.â€� Indeed, the billing was about the only thing on this stay that was done right. Since the clerk so carefully worded her inquiry and avoided asking me how my stay was, I decided to cut my losses and write this location off as â€œnever againâ€�. By now youâ€™re probably asking why I didnâ€™t engage a manager. Given the multiple areas of failure, it seems that the problem lies at the top of this propertyâ€™s food chain. Frankly, I felt that I would be wasting my time listening to hollow apologies. Regardless, I am frustrated and angered to the point that I need to let someone know. If you look at my membership file, you will see that I have curtailed my stays at IHG properties considerably, despite logging approximately 100 nights in hotels per year. This is due to the lack of consistency in the IHG brands and indifference to my loyalty. My recent stay at the Crowne Plaza Chicago Metro only reinforces that stance -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I wrote to IHG giving them the opportunity to respond. They of course forwarded my list of complaints to the hotel and had Ron Shelton (Assistant General Manager) contact me. He offered apologies (what else is he going to do?), 15,000 points and an email of apology from the General Manager. Eleven weeks passed with no points nor apology from the General Manager. After emailing IHG twice more, I received 10,000 points from the hotel (5,000 less than originally promised) but still no email from the General Manager. Frankly, these points have no value to me as I have no intent to stay with IHG again. Still, I'm fighting on principle as Crowne Plaza should deliver on its promises. If it weren't for my group having chosen this hotel, I would have stayed elsewhere. Regardless, next year I will stay independently if our group books the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “(half review) Good budget option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: First, I was here for a sleep study, so my room was arranged and paid for by someone else, and we were on the lowest floor. All in all the rooms are clean compfortable and no frills. On te two times I stayed there, the tub drained slow and the showerhead was leaking. (you get a nice movable showerhead, but the joints leaked). The WiFi is spotty. That said, if you're looking for a break on price, it's a good option in Chicago. You're between a drug store and a grocery store. You're in Greek Town and steps from Randolph St, so no shortage of great food, but you will need a super short cab or bus ride to access the other keyspots of Chicago, assuming you don't want to drive and/or pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cllawson22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a trip to see the ball parks of Chicago with friends. The hotel was amazingly clean, the rooms were amazing, and the views were beautiful. From our room on the 10th floor, you stood on the balconey and looked to the side and got a fantastic view of Sears Tower (especially at night). The staff was friendly and helpful: a light was out in our room - fixed by the time we returned from our day out, our cards to the door stoppped working and they immediately fixed it, our friends had a drain that didn't drain which was also fixed by the time we returned, they also offered to watch our bags for us after we checked out (but wanted to stay in the city for the day) and let us keep our car in the lot for free until 3 pm after check out. The restaurant on site was delicious (though the breakfast buffet wasn't really worth the money - just order the french toast!). There is no pool, but the exercise room was clean and nice. The beds were comfortable and had lots of pillows to choose from. The hotel is conviently located to bus and train (we walked mostly 2 blocks, but one time 4 blocks but still not bad and a nice neighborhood to walk through). It is also just off the freeway, so it was easy to find on our way into town (also made it easy to get out of town). The staff was also very helpful with taxis and directions to buses and trains. LOTS of fantastic places to eat nearby (Meli - OMG the best breakfast EVER, but go early- there was a huge crowd for it, but worth the wait! The lattes and stuffed french toast!, also a really good sushi restaurant about 3 blocks away). Bathrooms were small, but very clean and awesome lighting! Showers had nice rain heads with good water pressure. Only issue was no refrigerator in the room (can get one for a $50 charge) and we have insulin we needed to keep cold (but a cooler and the ice machine worked fine in a pinch. Awesome stay, would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional!”
Reviews.Author: Ziggs262
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we delt with a very pleasant gentleman by the name of Curtis. He was very friendly and nice to deal with. That's where it ended. On the last morning of our stay my wife was leaving prior to me and went down to get a cab. Two cabs pulled up and proceeded to argue with eachother as to who was going to take her to the airport. It ended with one of them grabbing her bag from her and throwing it into the cab. We visited to hotel bar later in the night where the working door man came in multiple times to get drinks and actually made comments about the drinks not being strong enough. Not sure why the bartender would serve someone that was working but that's just me. The next night the same doorman was leaning on the front counter in front of multiple customers making it very awkward for us/ them to get to the front to ask questions or check in. The elevator requires a key to get up to your room which I do like but it would be nice if the key readers worked. I was only able to get up one time out of the five without having to visit the front desk to ask why my card wouldn't work. While in the room they have a lock on the sliding glass door that's great but it only locks when the door is slightly open so I hope you like the sound of the city while you sleep. In addition to that the thing that you would pull the curtains closed with broke off right in my hand. Very cheap! Overall my experience was less than satisfactory. I stayed at the Afinia for the week prior and this was a night and day difference. The Afinia was excellent!!! Very professional and very nice!!! My brother is the GM of a hotel for a major chain in the Colorado area so I have started to take notice of the smaller things while visiting hotels in other states. I am in no way an expert but I know what professionalism is and what it should look like. The crown plaza reminded me of a hotel 6!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hoggards
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Crowne Plaza. The staff and management were friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our reservation at check-in and they immediately came up with a solution that was more than we expected. The rooms were clean and attractive. The beds were great! It was located next to the CTA bus stop and was next to a drug/grocery store that we shopped in every day fore snacks and other needed items. Starbucks was also lacated in the store so we had coffee there every morning. The restaurant was a little pricey but the food was ok. I do recommend this hotel. It also has a nice view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always, staff is superb!”
Reviews.Author: jjohn113
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at the Crowne Plaza Metro because of it's proximity to the United Center when Cirque du Soleil is in town. The staff is VERY cordial and will immediately remedy any problem. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Zaphyra
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 weeks in the Chicago Crowne Plaza chicago Metro hotel and I was really disappointed. First the location is quite (very?) bad. You can't be closer of the highway, so all night you hear the sounds of the cars. Greek town is not in downtown, and once you ahve done the 2 good restaurants of the areas you have always to take the cab to go to the good places. Then the hotel is very loud with exterior noise (highway) and interior noise (other rooms). I have slept very badly several nights whereas I am usually not very sensitive to the noise during the sleep. Moreover the beds are quite bad as I get a very bad backache during and after my stay. The laundry is often quite long (more than a day as they indicates) and you have to bring your clothes yourself to front desk because they are to busy to pick them up in your room. Some persons at the front desk are really unpleasant, and they do not always answer to the phone. Finally if the room is quite ok, the bathroom is small, sometimes dirty... not what you can expect from a Crowne Plaza. To sum up my stay was quite bad and I advise you to go somewhere else and better located.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly glamourous and petfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Adlai
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here and was surprised to find this hotel to be very glam. The bed was beyond comfortable, room service very efficient, front desk staff friendly and a great value to boot. And it is walkable to everywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized but an overall pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: moonsammy4
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms and very close to downtown and to the very cool Randolphe St. Checking in, checking out, storing bags, retrieving bags were all extremely slow and disorganized. I would stay again, though, and take my chances.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short business stay”
Reviews.Author: nijunihk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on business. Itâ€™s a perfectly fine hotel (if a bit older) in an average location, about 5 city blocks across the freeway from the CBD, walkable in nice weather. Free wifi in room is a definite plus. My room was very quiet because it did not face the freeway (it faced Walgreenâ€™s). I didnâ€™t have time to explore the area (only traveling back & forth to the office downtown, so maybe I missed attractions/restaurants in other directions, but just from what I could see, there wasnâ€™t much nearby, except for the nice grocery store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Greek town (and pet friendly)”
Reviews.Author: leigh1865
Reviews.Content: Spent nine nights at the Crowne Plaza Metro. Staff were terrific in all aspects! Great location in Greek town--perfect for as much Greek dining as you could ever want. I used the bus routes as well as taxis for getting to work and to Michigan Ave for shopping--both were very convenient and very easy! My room was a little small, but the walk out balcony made up for everything. This is a pet friendly hotel, and being able to have my dogs with me while being away from home for over a week made my business trip much more pleasant. I'll definitely stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyKate123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome because we drove to Chicago and it's right off of the highway. I liked that it wasn't downtown but that cabs were cheap and readily available!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jjscott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are usually stay here using points as a way to get in the city for a weekend getaway from the suburbs. It is the best value as far as I'm concerned. Very nice atmosphere, in a great location, and nice suites. All parking is valet which is really the only inconvenience since it is $30 or $35. There is a grocery store across the street if you need anything for your stay. Walking distance to the train. A little less expensive than staying on Michigan Avenue but no less in quality. One other suggestion would be for the rooms that open up outside, hire an exterminator. There are many spiders that could easily be eliminated either from housekeeping or a weekly inspection. We really couldn't utilize that nice feature of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Crowne Plaza Chicago in May 2011. The bedrooms are great and clean. There is coffee every morning in the front desk. The wifi is very slow, but there is a business center very good. The hotel is well located, but we love walk...so, we are not a standard couple.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, we got married here!”
Reviews.Author: aparad2
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I am partial to this hotel since it holds sentimental value for me. However, the whole reason we decided to hold such a special event here was because of the impeccable service, individual attention, and higher end vibe we received at the Metro. My husband and I first stayed in a suite that has a balcony that overlooks downtown Chicago. In fact, all of the rooms have full functioning balconies, something you don't see often in Chicago. The staff was very courteous and attentive. The rooms were well decorated and gave you a high end feel. I love, love, love their showers! Perfect water pressure and the hot water won't s boil you! The beds were very comfortable. The location of the hotel is very unique and is the only large hotel in the Greek Town/ West Loop area. I love this part of Chicago. It's close to spas, shops, tons of restaurants (seriously, TONS), and is close to University of IL- Chicago (UIC), University Village, United Center, Harpo Studios, which are all fun places to visit. Downtown Chicago is literally across the street (well, highway to be exact) and is within walking distance to the Loop. I definitely recommend this hotel for any trip to Chicago, meetings, or event.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable hotel - great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: LusoCanuck
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at this hotel. My options were limited at the time of booking and I chose it mainly because of low cost and proximity to the office I would be visiting. The hotel is clean, modern. My room had a fantastic bed. My rate included a breakfast, which had a good selection. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars was because the location will not likely appeal to the masses - it is in Greektown right next to the interstate highway, which can be dodgy and noisy. It is a bit of a walk from the downtown core and quite far from the touristy areas. That being said, I walked/jogged and had no problems getting to what I wanted to see on foot. Go to Giordano's pizza which is a couple of blocks away for awesome pizza, then have a night cap in the hotel bar, which was always buzzing. Oh, and it had an AMAZING gym!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: traveling4StLouiis
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights at less than $150 per night. Very courteous staff. nice view of the downtown. Walgreens and Dominicks (grocery) were in walking distance. My hubby was upset that there was no microwave or fridge =/. Didn't have to drive our car but paid $18/day for parking. There is a restaurant on site but I didn't eat there because I like to eat at signature Chicago restaurants there are tons of them within walking distance.Even in freezing temperatures. If you want to know anything about that area the vale drivers can help. Also Harpo studios (Oprah) is within walking distance as well,

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: AV_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location to explore the Chicago. Walking distance to downtown and Will's Towers (formerly Sear's Towers). Few steps away from the hotel are a number of nice restaurants at the Greek island plus a couple of 24 hour super markets for any emergency needs. The hotel itself isn't too great with basic facility and right next to busy freeway yet rooms are spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay longer than 1-2 nights”
Reviews.Author: LaPortuguesa
Reviews.Content: This felt like a cheap hotel. The Greektown location is not ideal in my opinion (if you donâ€™t like Greek food youâ€™re SOL for food) but the fact that itâ€™s a short (if not particularly pleasant) walk to the West Loop is convenient for business travelers. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mommawith2boys
Reviews.Content: I loved the Crowne Plaza. The location is close to the train station andalso close to many restaurant. The bar in the hotel is small but the staff are friendly and the service was great. Parking is cheaper right across the street at Park 1 rather than parking at the hotel which is quite expensive. I lked the balcony. Cabs available 24/7 if you want to head to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TinTexas
Reviews.Content: Can't really say anything bad about the hotel. It was clean and nice. I would suggest you park in the lot directly across the street and it will save you $16.00 a day. It is a good walk away from downtown, but busses going both ways stop right across the street from the hotel, so it is no big deal. I did wish the hotel had queen beds, a pool and had the bathroom sink area outside of the bathroom with the tub and toilet. That makes it so much easier when there is a family of four. There is a Domincks right across the street where you can get your CTA passes, a fresh salad or donuts, beer and wine, fresh friut, toileteries, batteries, etc. I would have no reservation staying again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: samryanhooch1
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so nice and helpful. Beautiful rooms, very clean and such a nice place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the occasion”
Reviews.Author: AbbyLynn84
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Metro for a family members wedding. They were very accommodating to our large group and special requests for certain rooms. The hotel is well maintained. Our room was clean and the size of an average hotel room. The restaurant was decently priced and had a good brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Chaznsf
Reviews.Content: Clean room, modern room, average size. Nice clean modern bathroom. Only problems were (1) no hot water for an 11 a.m. shower and (2) climate control unit in room did not respond to changes. Overall, would stay here again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy and safe”
Reviews.Author: JMcVeigh67
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd visit to the Crowne and I love it here. From the warm greeting at the desk to the interactions throughout the place. Rooms are clean and well maintained. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “ERIC IS A ROCK STAR ! - EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: einnejjja
Reviews.Content: Friend's flight was delayed on Sunday May 22nd due to bad weather. The staff at the Crowne were excellent, Eric was the front desk manager and in a very short time was able to accommodate my friends with an excellent rate and even allowed them some additional time to check out in the morning. All this was done with a very short time spent on the telephone. Thank you Eric and the Night audit worker, you helped to take the stress out of travel delay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel , good value and many conveniences nearby.”
Reviews.Author: cbl7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in Chicago. The reason I chose this hotel was based on all the positive reviews and a reasonable rate as well as the convenience of having a Supermarket(dominicks), a Walgreens, a Starbucks and a few restaurants all within a block radius. If you are traveling on a budget, getting food at the market is a good place to get food. It is in Greektown, so most of the restaurants nearby are Greek, but there menus are all full of many varieties. Of course the hotel has it's own restaurant, I did not have a chance to eat there, just had drinks. The room was clean and well maintained, each room has a balcony. The rooms are a little small, but for a solo traveler, it's good enough. I would not recommend it for couples or families. The bathroom is a little small as well. They have free wifi and wired interenet. The wifi slowed down at night, so I ended using the wire which was provided in the room. I guess there are too many users. But overall the stay was good. I would definately stay here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Crowne”
Reviews.Author: dermotm
Reviews.Content: I recently had a weeks business stay here. It really has everything that the business traveller requires. The rooms are a good size and well appointed. Very clean, plenty of towels and a quiet environment. The staff are excellent and always available to assist. It's only a short walk to the river, but there are always taxis outside the building. From the city every taxi driver knows the hotel and the location. Good grocery and coffee shops across the road. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Iampinoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. My room was clean. The hotel staff was amazing and friendly. They were always kind, courteous and helpful. There is a grocery store across the street. A Walgreen's right behind the hotel and across the street a Starbucks. We used the meeting room and they were always clean. The sales rep Carol Bader was awesome. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Valinor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights to see Bon Jovi at Soldier's Field. We were in a Jr Suite. The stay was perfect. The hotel was beautiful and all of the staff amazing. There is a Grocery store on one side and a drug store on the other. This property is at the Northern point of Greek Town. We had lots of fun walking around there and we had dinner there Saturday night. It was wonderful. Great food and great people. We will be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Ken32648
Reviews.Content: I usually stay here when I come back to my hometown and the staff always makes me feel like a king!

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ayrshirelinz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in February and had a very nice stay. Booked our flight and hotel package through e-bookers and all details were correct when checking in, the room was clean and everything you would expect from a crowne plaza (only thing missing was a mini-bar in the room). The hotel may not be right in the downtown area but you just have to cross the street and there is a bus that takes you there in minutes, our 7 day pass for the CTA was a good buy! We went on the CTA from the airport blue-line to UCL-Halstead and it was just a short walk to the hotel from there. Enough bars and restaurants nearby if you dont want to head downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Book With An Online Service!”
Reviews.Author: ibmerlin
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel using an online site like Hotels.com!! We booked a King bed non smoking for a one night stay to celebrate our anniversary. Upon arriving a very rude front deck clerk informed us that they"Crowne plaza metro" did not have to honor our King bed booking because it was made with an online service and instead we were going to get a Double room. If we didnt take it we would lose ALL the money.Final in the room we find two small beds. Im a big guy. So, To make a long story short. I spent my anniversary sleeping alone. My wife woke the next day with a rash from the detergent they use. (We hope thats what it was) So thank you Crowne plaza Metro for an Anniversary that nether my wife or I will ever forget!

Reviews.Title: “A worry-free stay”
Reviews.Author: 2FoodJunkies
Reviews.Content: Checking in and out was a breeze and there were no problems with charges on our bill. You need a room key to access the elevators which was a nice touch and made us feel more secure. Our room on the 8th floor was clean and comfortable. The beds were decent and the shower was lovely. We enjoyed the view from the balcony, especially at night. The hotel is right off the highway and the walls aren't terribly soundproof so expect some noise. The internet connection was lousy, but free. Do not use their valet parking, there are at least 2-3 lots right across the street that offer self-parking for much cheaper. We did self-park above Dominick's. Overall, we had a nice stay and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mknutter
Reviews.Content: We did a long weekend trip to Chicago for sightseeing. This hotel was sufficient. It has a modern look and feel to it, from the main entrance to the rooms. Our room was nice. Nothing fancy. We have stayed in cleaner and nicer hotels. Had to have our sheets changed because there was something crusty on them...but they promptly came up and took care of it. Besides that, we didn't really have any issues. The room just didn't feel clean after that. The location isn't bad, definitely not ideal though. It is a short walk to downtown, but not in the center of downtown. But we did feel safe in it. There are probably better deals you can find in a downtown hotel, but if we had to, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay...but”
Reviews.Author: crown45
Reviews.Content: Great place but I was told when I made the reservation that parking was free. It was $36.00 to park and you had to use their valet service. Call me an old fasioned farm boy but the valet service is a joke! Quite a rip off actually. Not only was I very capable of parking my own vehicle and carrying my bags the 60 or so feet to the front door I actually would have prefered these guys not get in my vehicle!!

Reviews.Title: “Car Stolen from Valet Lot”
Reviews.Author: tkeaty
Reviews.Content: The keys to my Cadillac CTS was given to someone off the street by the valet company. Valet Authority Inc. Which the hotel requires you to use. I am out of pocket for the insurance deductible and the rekeying of my home. This happened on my wedding night no less. They have been no help and evidently don't care to help resolve my remaining issues. The general manager called me once and left a message never bothering to return my calls and talk to me personally.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel Car was broken into under their supervison took no responsiblity”
Reviews.Author: TravelLots38
Reviews.Content: This hotel look great from the outside but car was broken into 15 paces away from valet stand!! Supposedly it was broken into when security guard was on break. Between 5am and 7AM! ???You have better look parking on any street than paying 36.00 a day for them to take care of your car. Assistant Manager was not helpful. Would not call the police until I insisted. Would not park my car under canopy when it was pouring down rain until I insisted. Did not inform me of paperwork to fill out from valet company. You can forget about valet company. You would be safer sleeping in a tent outside the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “incompatent employees - front desk, accounting and manager - oh my!”
Reviews.Author: delivervalueplease
Reviews.Content: walked in to get a quote on a room as friends were staying there while in town but decided a rollaway was sufficient since $169 was the best price offered at 2am and just no way it was worth it at all for that kind of money. although assured by the front desk guy that nothing had been rung or entered in the system, today I have a $245 charge for an "unfulfilled reservation" appearing on my account. after over 7 phone calls to the hotel talking to the unhelpful girl in accounting as well as the front desk manager, finally it looks like it just might be ok. watch out!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Greektown”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of few I have been in with a balcony. The hotel is next to a freeway so expect some noise if the window is open but otherwise we had no problems and I loved the view of the city and being close to greektown which is nice to walk around. Next to the hotel is a walgreens and an overpriced supermarket. Buses stop outsid eteh hotel and it is only 10mins by bus to downtown. The hotel is nicely fitted and has a restaurant we had breakfast in one day for free as Priority Club members but they ended up charging us by mistake this was corrected after an email to them. I would stay here again if I was in Chicago as I liked the area and it had more life than Downtown which is lifeless during the holidays or weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: lovelabslots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business in September because the normal Chicago hotel I use was booked. The location was convenient. The check in was fine although the staff wasn't as friendly or helpful as I was hoping. One thing I don't like about Crowne Plaza's in general is no water in the room, and having to resort to the vending machines on the floor. For business travelers that is pretty annoying. I ordered room service and it was quite good and have no complaints there. The fitness center was small, and multiple machines were broken but there was one working elliptical and one treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “Within Walking Distance to Harpo Studios”
Reviews.Author: ILoveChicago123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was definitely within walking distance to Harpo Studios. The hotel is nice, service was good, no complaints really. However for the price, there was nothing special about the hotel. It's about 1 1/2 miles from the downtown shopping area (less than a 10 minute cab drive) and there's really nothing around the area that's worth walking to. We would only book this hotel again if we were going back to see Oprah but otherwise we'd stay downtown for maybe a 3-star hotel for less. The hotel was nice enough though to allow us to have late check out at 1pm for no additional cost. Valet parking is $32/day to park in a lot that's a 1minute walk to the front door. Overall, we did have a pleasant experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with unmatched value.”
Reviews.Author: indaystime
Reviews.Content: Drove up from Atlanta 22 of October to visit my best friend & the drive was amazingly long but all thoughts of tiredness went out the door when my boyfriend & I saw what great accommodations were reserved for us. The hotel was in a great location,the price was unmatched by any,relatively close to downtown,the staff was definitely on point & OMG the beds felt like laying on a million little fingers massaging me to sleep. We were expecting the weather to be a little on the chilly side but it stayed quite comfortable & being able to stroll the magnificent mile without heavy coats was A-1. Once back at the hotel we found the view & the setting to be very romantic (even with a wedding going on they made us feel as important as the bride & groom),the room was gorgeous,the bathroom beautiful & the memories forever remembered ! Can't wait until my next visit !

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: jusmith27
Reviews.Content: Great location on edge of Greektown and lovely modern rooms. The entire staff was eager to help from the moment we got out of the car to check in. We were able to check in early and the process was extremely quick. Rooms are well appointed with nice furniture, desk with internet access, and huge king sized bed. We had a great view of downtown from the balcony too. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and everything was great. Would highly recommend the Crowne Plaza Metro to anyone for leisure or business; we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms,”
Reviews.Author: SmilingHospitality
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Metro and have to say that this hotel is fantastic! The rooms are huge! I had a room with a living room and a door separating the bed room. The room was beautifully decorated with a contemporary design scheme which I personally like quite a bit. I really can't say enough about the room size especially for a business traveler itâ€™s great! The bathroom was awesome I wished I took pictures of it as it was all white and looked beautiful. The Bed was super comfortable as I slept like a baby in the room. The only thing I was a little not happy with was the noise from the sliding door. The sliding door was not a double pane so the noise from the outside seem to easily come into the room even on the floor I was on which I can't remember but was high up that we needed to use our room key in the elevator to access the floor. Other than that the room was awesome. I actually have some pictures from the balcony please take a look. I would highly recommend this hotel for its location as itâ€™s in Greek town with some excellent food choices. Itâ€™s a bit of a walk from the happening Bar area but if youâ€™re up for it give it a shot because there are always Taxi's running which I caught every day I was there. The breakfast in the restaurant was great nice selection for a buffet breakfast. I also had the opportunity to meet up with a co-worker in the bar in the evening and it seems to be a fairly business place to meet as well. Check it out. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in the Chicago Downtown area. Oh by the way itâ€™s down the street from the subway which runs to Oâ€™Hare airport. I caught the subway for I think $2.75 much cheaper than a $30 taxi ride. However plan ahead as the subway ride takes about 45mins to an hour.

Reviews.Title: “To much noisy,and I was charged in US$37 for 1 min. international call!Got no answer about it after claim by e-mail.”
Reviews.Author: cris033
Reviews.Content: Noisy!!! I was charged in US$37 for a 1min international phone call. It was the highest charge i received for a phone call in life!!! I made a claim about it by e-mail to manager but got no answer. Travellers, beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: dcmcguire
Reviews.Content: The room decor is attractive, wi-fi and bottled water are complimentary, but it's the staff that's truly remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Gluehuffer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a overnight trip to Chicago. As stated in other reviews there is a $36 charge for parking for the night. I arrived early and it was awesome they had my room ready at about noon. Room was nice. Had a corner room that had a balcony. No complaints and would stay there again. Wife said the exercise room looked nice but didn't use it as didn't have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but out of downtown area”
Reviews.Author: TheTFamily04
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a short stay but would not recommend for more than a couple of days. They do not have a microwave nor fridge in a standard room and no on-site pool. The area around the hotel seemed fine and thank God for the sound proof glass based on location near the major highway. The parking is $36 per night but there is $20 parking per night across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay.”
Reviews.Author: travlerII
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel, and found no fault worth mentioning. we where here for a vacation. The neighborhood is Greek Town, which I found to be a plus. Always like to try something new. We are walkers, so we did a lot of walking, but there a watertaxis(within a couple blocks of the Hotel) or buses if you don't care to walk, but you miss a lot of the flavor of Chicago by just riding through it. Getting back to the neighborhood, there are many restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel that offer excellent food. For Breakfast we walked to Meli's, about two blocks away, for the BEST Breakfast you'll run across in the whole of Chicago, very reasonable. Would definitely stay at this property again,when in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: ikris72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and was positively surprised by the room, very clean and I had two double beds to myself. Even though the hotel is located right by the expressway, I found the location good and Greektown was a nice area to stay in. Close to Union Station, and if you don't mind walking it is not that far to get downtown. All rooms have balconies. Restaurant nice but expensive. I would recommend eating at one of the many nearby places instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Barisarius
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we though we would be in for a significantly better than average stay. What a disappointment. Pre-paid reservations for a king bed, non-smoking, corner unit. On arrival was advised that king bed was not available and only double beds available. After some discussion, I was offered a coupon for a free breakfast and guaranteed to be moved to a king bed the next day. Breakfast was not good. Buffet or order off the menu. I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon and fruit. Eggs were dry, bacon was decent, fruit was overripe. I did get the king bed. Bathroom sink design is interesting. It seems that some designed thought that if you put the faucet on the left side of the sink, it would make a design statement. Guess what? It did not. Water pressure was not good. Air conditioner noise was very loud. Other than that, it was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad option”
Reviews.Author: flybynite85
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal on this hotel via a discount online travel agency, getting the 4th night free. Room was clean & reasonably quiet considering it is right beside a very busy highway (I94/I90). Staff was friendly & helpful (other than not having a bellman show up with a luggage cart on leaving). While location wasn't bad, it isn't right downtown & requires a cab ride to Mag Mile, Navy Pier, Grant Park, etc., though give the price we got, it was worth it. Within walking distance to Greektown restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...an ok place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: cjsclark
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for a concert at Soldier Field. We picked it b/c location wasn't an issue for us, we were going to have to use transportation from any hotel to get to Soldier Field. It was also an extremely busy weekend and if the hotels on Mich. Ave weren't sold out, they were $300 a night! As a Priority Club gold customer, we were upgraded to a King Suite, which meant a room with a pullout couch and a room with a king bed. The king bed was comfy, and the AC worked wonderfully, and the water pressure in the shower was good with HOT water. It was an easy walk from Union Station, but we did take a cab to the El. There was no wait for our car the next morning with valet parking. Yes, you will hear highway noise but we did not hear noise from our neighbors. One of our TVs didn't work, and we did have to call up housekeeping at 2 AM to get the sheets and blankets for the pullout bed. But those weren't deal breakers to us. This was a fine hotel for a very busy weekend in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before taking the California Zephyr train from Union Station. The hotel is well located just West of the Sears Tower. Unlike some previous reviewers I thought the location was ideal for walking to and from - it's about a 10 minute walk to Union Station (even with luggage) and it is cheap and easy to get cabs to and from the hotel if you don't fancy the walk. There are dozens of restaurants and Walgreens within a few hundred metres of the hotel. Check-in and check-out was smooth and courteous, and when we requested a refrigerator for the room for some medication it arrived very quickly and without charge. The room was comfortable if a little small and had a tiny balcony with views over the city. We had lunch and a drink in the hotel bar/diner attached which was good and had some interesting microbrewery beers. I was a little concerned as to whether the hotel would be noisy as there was (I think) a school prom going on and a big group of partying teenagers in the next room, but I heard no noise at all at night. I have never understood the difference between Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn and don't know why the same company uses both brands - this was indistinguishable from any Holiday Inn. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place”
Reviews.Author: lsabjazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine and everything was as expected. The room was clean (perhaps a bit small), location was close to UIC (where we were visiting) and restaurants on Halsted offered a good variety of Greek food (and other mainstreams, such as Starbucks). A nice grocery store (Dominick's) was up the road also. Everyone was friendly. At one point our TV suddenly failed to operate and, after phoning the front desk about it, a repairman showed up within minutes and fixed the problem. Also, parking was cheap for a downtown Chicago hotel--$36 valet with full in-and-out. Most other hotels are well over $40 a night. Although the area is a bit outside of the mainstream tourist area (it's in the West Loop), this is still a fine place to spend a couple of nights in the city. And it's easy to get to off of I-90/94.

Reviews.Title: “beware of bogus bill charges”
Reviews.Author: lahianagirl01
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for the Taste of Chicago over the 4th. When we arrived at the hotel we were pleased with the rooms and found them to be very clean and well kept. The beds were very soft and I found it hard to sleep. The bar in the hotel was nice but over priced. The nacho's were pretty good but don't waste your money on the calamari, I am still not sure if it was calamari. Several people had gotten stuck in an elevator for about an hour and there were elevator issues the weekend so we took the stair most of the time to the 4th floor so that we would not become trapped. The location for the Taste was very bad and that was my friends fault. If you want to spend a lot of time near Grant park or Navy Pier this is not the right Hotel for you. The only major issue was when we went to check out we were charged for room service we did not order. Another man leaving at the same time we were was upset because his bill showed he had rented movies which he states he did not do. So if you decide to stay at this location make sure to check your bill out closely. Also, if you choose this location and like breakfast check out Meli a great breakfast restuarant about two blocks away from the hotel. Its a little spendy but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: kydancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like it suggests! Far away from Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier and everything else in the city! Pay a little extra for The Hyatt or Marriot downtown...the cab rides will make up the difference!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Inattentive I-Don't-Care Staff Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: Travel_LadyNYC
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its proximity to the Amtrak Station. We were just using it as a quick way-station between the train one day and a flight the next. I cannot understand why Crowne Plaza is considered upscale. The accommodations are certainly acceptable, but not much more â€“ and the service at this location was appalling. I called a couple weeks before my stay and there was no answer for five + minutes. My next phone experience was after check-in. The ventilation system didnâ€™t work, so I telephoned for assistance. The operator put me through to front desk and it went straight to voice mail!! I tried again and no operator picked up at all. My husband finally went down to the front desk which was unattended; he had to search for someone to help him. With 398 guest rooms, you would think someone would be minding the place. When my husband finally located someone, they told him that theyâ€™d send someone up to take care of the problem. I called down to ask when heâ€™d get there and I was told (verbatim): â€œWhen he knocks on your door.â€� When the man arrived, we showed him the wall unit and demonstrated that turning the dial did nothing. He says, no, you have to use the thermostat â€“ which was way on the other side of the room. We didnâ€™t even see it and apparently the front desk personnel didnâ€™t know anything about it, as I learned when I later explained what happened to the in case another guest had a similar experience. And the system didnâ€™t work anyhow. There is no setting for â€œfan.â€� It is either AC or heat with an automatic turn-off when the room reaches the desired temperature; we had to keep adjusting the temperature all night. Although there was a balcony, we couldnâ€™t leave it open it for fresh air because of the roar of traffic from the adjacent expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Where were the staff?”
Reviews.Author: ashlessinseattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Metro because I was in town for a convention and it was one of the few hotels with availability at under $400 a night (just) for a late booking. OK, I know they are running a business, but.... where were the staff. Waited 10 minutes for check in because there was only one person at the desk and so it was throughout my 4 day stay, although surprisingly there were always at least 2 bell hops taking care of the $36/day "valet only" parking. There is no concierge service at this hotel either. I arrived very early so had breakfast in the restaurant which was also completely understaffed so I just got up and helped myself to the (very poor) breakfast buffet. The room was a large, corner room on the 14th floor "quiet zone" and it certainly was quiet. However, this particular corner of the hotel overlooked the freeway so I can't believe that there wasn't better window glazing to cut down on the traffic noise. All in all I would have felt aggrieved paying $200/night let alone the near $400 it was costing (including taxes). Pretty poor show!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hollydollyMontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with for a girls friends weekend in Chicago. The hotel was very clean and the staff were all friendly. It is a bit of a walk to the Mag Mile but in comfy shoes it is not a problem. The public transit system is very easy to use and we hoped on and off a few buses while sight-seeing. The hotel was in Greektown so there were lots of great restaurents to choose from right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. Actually located in the West Loop just west of the river on the Sears Tower side of the city. Kinda nice since you are not in the overcrowded Michigan Avenue area and can breath a little bit. Right next to Greek Town with great Greek restaurants within a block of the hotel. Very nice rooms and main areas. Would definitely stay there again. The only negative was there is only valet parking and it was very expensive. I want to say $39 per day but check the hotel's web site to verify this. Beds were too hard but got used to them.

Reviews.Title: “The property is placed in the right place at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: Testech
Reviews.Content: I can walk next door the Walgreens, the door men know *Everything* there is always a cab, I can get to union station on foot in a block or two. I don't need a car to get everywhere but there is always a cab. The food is fantastic. The only downer we had was the computers in the resturant kept crashing. the name is Micros, must be junk becuase everthing else was perfect from the room to the staff. Even the Valet had their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Walls thin, noisy. Bed was hard as a rock!”
Reviews.Author: IowaKtg
Reviews.Content: They made the bed on the wrong side so it was very hard. the second day they flipped the bed for us. Little things wrong. Coffee maker did not work nor remote control. staff was nice. They said they would send a voucher for a delux room in a week and never did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ! Outstanding Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: tltk71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay in Chicago to see an Oprah Winfrey show . The Crowne Plaza -Metro was in a perfect location to walk to Harpo Studios, Willis Tower, and for some general sightseeing. The valet and bellman attendants went above and beyond to help make our stay memorable . They were always there to answer any of our questions, and even ordered in our Deep Dish Pizza. The shower in our room at the Crowne Plaza -Metro was probably the best shower I have ever had in a hotel . Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise at the price”
Reviews.Author: letsgo36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business meetings for 3 nites. The price was very reasonable. Hotel very clean. Has somewhat of a "sterile" feel of an urban hotel in a large downtown setting, but staff was friendly and helpful, especially on knowledge of area restaurants. Had a king room and it was very large, including a very nice large "L-shaped" desk for me to work at. Could hear street traffic sounds all night, but not bad, and no noise was heard from adjoining rooms. Large fitness center, too. Would recommend this hotel if need to be within walking distance of many businesses between it and MIchigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: shakiralovejamison
Reviews.Content: Girls Weekend in Chicago, Rolled up the the CP in Greektown. Location was fine. Parking not under ground as I had expected for the $36 price tag "valet." At the end of the trip it was clear to me that my car was above ground. Which pisses me off since there were so many lots around the hotel for dirt cheap. I also have a sneaking suspicion that the valet guys didn't simply take my car to the parking lot and maybe did a few errands in it. Can't validate, just some things with my car leads me to this. There was a young valet guy who took my ticket that I was supposed to keep, which made my wait a little longer at checkout. The Bellman took so long bringing up our luggage that we went down to get it ourselves and then as we were getting off the elevator at the Lobby floor he was about to get on with two different luggage carts, neither of which were ours. HOWEVER, he believed that one of them belonged to us and was on his way up to bring up the WRONG luggage. The beds were too firm, the decor was strange.
